body_html:
@vrv If run without --cuda, this test is useless and shouldn't run at all,
correct? And we don't build with --cuda on Mac. Or at least we shouldn't.

On Thu, Feb 4, 2016 at 10:49 AM caisq notifications@github.com wrote:

@vrv https://github.com/vrv For the PIP install-test, it is to
blacklist a test. Unfortunately this is not a PIP install-test. It is a C++
unit test. Is there an easy way to disable this C++ unit test depending on
the OS in Mac i Bazel, without changing the source code?

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
#965 (comment)
.

body:
@vrv If run without --cuda, this test is useless and shouldn't run at all,
correct? And we don't build with --cuda on Mac. Or at least we shouldn't.

On Thu, Feb 4, 2016 at 10:49 AM caisq notifications@github.com wrote:

> @vrv https://github.com/vrv For the PIP install-test, it is to
> blacklist a test. Unfortunately this is not a PIP install-test. It is a C++
> unit test. Is there an easy way to disable this C++ unit test depending on
> the OS in Mac i Bazel, without changing the source code?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
